lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin imstwin pwn suDw rs pujis n swD muK mDur bcn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Misataani Paan Sudhaa Rasa , Pujasi N Saadh Moukh Madhur Bachan Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Countless eatables of elixir like sweet tastes are nowhere equal to the sweet words uttered by saintly persons.

lines.gurmukhi: sIql sugMD cMd cMdn kotwin koit pujis n swD miq inmRqw scn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Seetal Sougandh Chand Chandan Kotaani Koti , Pujasi N Saadh Mati Nimrataa Sachan Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The tranquillity and coolness of million moons and fragrance of million sandalwood trees cannot be even a patch on the humility of saintly Sikhs of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin kwmDyn Aau klpqr pujis n ikMcq ktwC ky rcn kau
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Kaamadhayn Au Kalapatara , Pujasi N Kinchat Kataachh Kay Rachan Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A little glance of grace and kindness of the True Guru as a result of perpetual meditation of Naam, cannot be compared with millions of heavenly cows (Kamdhenu) and all granting tree (Kalap-brichh).

lines.gurmukhi: srb inDwn Pl skl kotwin koit pujis n praupkwr ky Kcn Kau ]130]
lines.transliteration_english: Sarab Nidhaan Dhal Sakal Kotaani Koti , Pujasi N Paraoupakaar Kay Khachan Khau ?130?

Shabad OS B.translation: All treasures and fruits of labour even when multiplied million times cannot reach the philanthropic deeds of Guru's Sikhs. (130)
